column4: any advice whether i can use DNS to resolve just local IPs? currently other PCs on the network sporadically get confused when trying to browse to external websites
LjjL. yes, i'd like to set up a sandbox server, and browse to http://sandbox.local from other PCs
dns is checked in second state by other PCs on the network, or just the ubuntu instance>
ok it's the other network PCs that are getting confused. sounds like i should disabled DNS on the ubuntu server
- i'd like to browse to http://sandbox.local, and also not have other network PCs confused (as the currently, sporadically are) when trying to browse to external websites
then you have a dns server in ubuntu and this one is used to resolve names by the rest of boxes?
ok, then you must configure in your dns server sandbox.local.com to the IP where its stored
or write sandbox.local in every hosts file of your boxes
i see, the clients' hosts files need to know where to find http://sandbox.local, w/o DNS the server can't do that
